resource_dependency.newsDataAPI: GET /api/news endpoint returning list of news articles with fields: id, title, summary, content, published_at, image_url.
resource_dependency.companyProfilesAPI: GET /api/companies endpoint returning list of companies with fields: id, name, description, logo_url, website.
resource_dependency.eventsAPI: GET /api/events endpoint returning list of events with fields: id, title, description, event_date, location, is_past_event.
resource_dependency.newsletterSubscribeAPI: POST /api/newsletter/subscribe expecting { email: string } in request body.
resource_dependency.adSpacesAPI: GET /api/ads endpoint returning list of active ads with fields: id, title, image_url, target_url, placement_area.

function: Display homepage with navigation bar and sections for News, Companies, Events, Newsletter Subscription, and Ad Spaces.
static_description: The page displays a header with navigation links to News, Companies, Events, and Admin Panel. Below the header is a main content area featuring a grid layout showing latest news snippets, followed by company cards, upcoming events, and an advertisement banner. At the bottom, thereâ€™s a newsletter subscription form with an input field for email and a subscribe button. Background color set to #FDF5E6 (old lace) and component borders/text use #BC8F8F (rosy brown).

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking on any news card navigates to the full article view.
Clicking on any company card navigates to the detailed company profile page.
Clicking on any event card navigates to the event details page.
Clicking the Subscribe button submits the entered email via POST to /api/newsletter/subscribe.

resource_dependency.adminLoginAPI: POST /api/admin/login expecting { username: string, password: string }, returns JWT token upon success.
resource_dependency.authMiddleware: All protected routes require Bearer Token Authorization header.

function: Provide secure login access to administrative backend panel.
static_description: A standalone login page displayed when accessing /admin without valid credentials. Contains two input fields labeled Username and Password, along with a Login button. Page background uses #FDF5E6 (old lace) and form elements styled with #BC8F8F (rosy brown).

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking the Login button sends credentials to /api/admin/login. On success, redirects to admin dashboard; otherwise shows error message.

function: Allow authenticated admins to manage news articles through CRUD operations.
static_description: Admin dashboard contains a tabbed interface with 'News', 'Companies', 'Events', and 'Ads'. In the News tab, a table lists existing articles with columns for Title, Date, Summary, Actions. Above the table is a Create New Article button which opens a modal containing form inputs for each news attribute.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking Create New Article opens a modal with a blank form for entering article details.
Clicking Save in the modal sends data via POST to /api/admin/news. Upon success, the new entry appears in the table.
Clicking Edit next to an article loads its data into the same modal via GET /api/admin/news/:id. Clicking Save updates the record via PUT /api/admin/news/:id.
Clicking Delete prompts confirmation then removes the article via DELETE /api/admin/news/:id.

function: Enable administrators to create, update, and delete company profiles.
static_description: Within the Companies tab of the admin dashboard, a table displays all current company entries with Name, Description preview, Website link, and Action buttons. There is also a Create New Company button above the table that opens a modal with form fields matching company attributes.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking Create New Company opens a modal with empty form fields for company info.
Clicking Save in the modal sends data via POST to /api/admin/companies. Success adds the new row to the table.
Clicking Edit loads the selected company's data into the modal via GET /api/admin/companies/:id. Saving updates it via PUT /api/admin/companies/:id.
Clicking Delete confirms deletion before sending DELETE request to /api/admin/companies/:id.

function: Support creation, modification, and removal of industry events by authorized users.
static_description: Inside the Events tab of the admin panel, a sortable table shows all events including columns for Title, Event Date, Location, Status (Past/Future), and Action buttons. A Create New Event button sits atop the table, opening a modal form pre-filled with event-related input fields.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking Create New Event opens a modal with form fields for event details.
Clicking Save posts data to /api/admin/events. Successful submission appends the event to the table.
Clicking Edit retrieves event data via GET /api/admin/events/:id and populates the modal. Changes saved via PUT /api/admin/events/:id.
Clicking Delete requires confirmation prior to executing DELETE /api/admin/events/:id.

function: Allow administrators to control advertising space placements throughout the frontend.
static_description: Located within the Ads tab of the admin dashboard, this section presents a table listing all current advertisements showing Title, Placement Area, Preview Image, Target URL, and Action controls. A Create New Ad Space button leads to a modal form allowing upload or selection of ad assets and configuration of placement areas.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking Create New Ad Space opens a modal with form fields for ad metadata and asset references.
Clicking Save submits the ad data via POST to /api/admin/ads. If successful, the ad is added to the table.
Clicking Edit pulls existing ad data via GET /api/admin/ads/:id and fills the modal. Updates are sent via PUT /api/admin/ads/:id.
Clicking Delete asks for confirmation before triggering DELETE /api/admin/ads/:id.

resource_dependency.dbSchemaInstructions: CREATE TABLE news_articles (id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, title TEXT NOT NULL, summary TEXT, content TEXT NOT NULL, published_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP, image_url TEXT); CREATE TABLE companies (id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL, description TEXT, logo_url TEXT, website TEXT); CREATE TABLE events (id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, title TEXT NOT NULL, description TEXT, event_date DATE NOT NULL, location TEXT, is_past_event BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE); CREATE TABLE advertisements (id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, title TEXT, image_url TEXT, target_url TEXT, placement_area TEXT); CREATE TABLE newsletter_subscribers (id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, email VARCHAR(255) UNIQUE NOT NULL, subscribed_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP); CREATE TABLE admins (id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, username VARCHAR(255) UNIQUE NOT NULL, password_hash TEXT NOT NULL);

function: Define database schema to support core entities: news articles, companies, events, advertisements, subscribers, and admin accounts.
static_description: A PostgreSQL database initialized with tables named news_articles, companies, events, advertisements, newsletter_subscribers, and admins. Each table includes appropriate primary keys, foreign keys where needed, and relevant columns per entity specifications.
